The Alchemist Behind It

▶ Specs loaded

/ Readme.md

Welcome to the corner of the internet where things get built, not just for the scroll, but for the story. This isn’t just a site. It’s a working archive of experiments, learnings, and quiet flexes.

I’m Juno Watts. I design with rhythm, build with care, and believe every detail deserves a reason to exist. From quick sketches to final deploy, everything here was made with intent and maybe a bit of caffeine. This space is built for motion, meaning, and messing around until it clicks.

Orange Room

Orangeroom.uk.co

Website

June 2024

Creative Dev, Experimental

Client

Layer Eleven

▶ Stack


Next.js

Tailwind CSS

Supabase

Framer Motion

GSAP

Lenis

▶ Background


Orange Room started as a visual experiment for Layer Eleven — a space to explore how structure, motion, and contrast could speak without words. The brief was intentionally abstract. The execution had to be precise. Built from scratch with a custom scroll system, layered transitions, and a minimalist grid, the site blends cinematic visuals with frontend discipline.

▶ Interface Study

/ Moodboard

▶ Client Review


Working with Juno felt more like teaming up with a creative partner than hiring a developer. From the first conversation, he understood the energy and mood we were aiming for. He asked the right questions, explored visual directions with intent, and delivered a build that felt as thoughtful as it was bold.


Every detail, from scroll behavior to motion timing was carefully considered. Juno brought clarity to a concept that had only lived in loose sketches and moodboards. He helped us tell a story through interface and interaction. The result is something that not only represents who we are, but inspires how we build from here.
